column4: how can i tell whether the computer is using software or hardware rendering?

but i want to make sure it is supporting and using as much hardware as it can

hehe i have the same graphics onboard

ok all you need to do to get the best performance out of that card is to make sure the driver is in xorg.conf
okay, how do i get to that?
the card worked ok, but i found it useless for composite effects, however for basic media playback etc it does fine
it says "Driver "sis"", which im guessing is a good thing? and it also says SiS 661FX which is what i entered when i ran "sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg"
is there a glx/opengl test i can do?
the gears turn smoothly for a second and then stop, turn slightly, stop for a second, turn slightly, stop et cetera. the gears wont run smoothly.
i would expect them to be quite poor, the SIS card is internal and shares its memory bus with the CPU i believe
as long as you have SIS as the driver, and xorg is running OK i dont think theres much more you can do
